author: undetermined
full_text:
India's GDP growth at 7.8% in April-June quarter

India recorded GDP growth of 7.8 per cent in the April-June quarter of 2023-24 against 13.1 per cent in the year-ago period, according to the National Statistical Data (NSO).

India remains the fastest-growing major economy as China's GDP growth in the April-June quarter was 6.3 per cent.

As per the NSO data, the agriculture sector recorded a 3.5 per cent growth, up from 2.4 per cent in the April-June quarter of 2022-23.

Key points:
- GDP growth rate: 7.8% for April-June 2023-24
- Previous year same quarter growth: 13.1%
- Agriculture sector growth: 3.5%
- Comparative performance: Fastest-growing major economy
- Comparison with China: China's GDP growth was 6.3% in the same quarter
title:
India's GDP growth at 7.8% in April-June quarter.

India recorded GDP growth of 7.8 per cent in the April-June quarter of 2023-24 against 13.1 per cent in the year-ago period, according to the National Statistical Data (NSO).

India remains the fastest-growing major economy as China's GDP growth in the April-June quarter was 6.3 per cent.

As per the NSO data, the agriculture sector recorded a 3.5 per cent growth, up from 2.4 per cent in the April-June quarter of 2022-23.
vclaim: India's GDP grew by 7.8% in April-June 2023-24 quarter, down from 13.1% in the same period last year. India remains the fastest-growing major economy, outpacing China's 6.3% growth in the same quarter. India's agriculture sector showed improvement with 3.5% growth compared to 2.4% in the previous year's corresponding quarter.
